bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to George L. Rives, May 23, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Hon. G. L. Rives Assistant Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: Yours of the 16th inst. came duly to hand and I was more than glad that items of disallowances made against me had your careful consideration. Am I to understand that "Items of Disallownaces 4 9, and 11, for messenger service and for such portion of items 15 s is made up of compensation messenger" only be drawn y me, which above amount is $75 50/100. Shall I draw for the same? Please inform me. I feel contented with

your judgement in my se, but please your honor inform Mrs Hopkins officially that what she expects the epartment of State to pay me involve upon her to do so for burial of her husband Moses A. Hopkins.
I have the honor to be, SIr, Yours Truly
Samuel S. Sevier Address 57 South St. New York
